learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate an understanding of and an ability to critically apply occupational hygiene principles to the anticipation, recognition, evaluation, communication and control of workplace health hazards.
Review and apply key toxicology principles, exposure standards and basic statistics to the evaluation of complex occupational health and hygiene risks.
Demonstrate an understanding of and an ability to apply the principles of the hierarchy of control to the selection of control measures for a range of complex occupational health hazards.
Select appropriate equipment to measure specific airborne contaminants and devise suitable sampling strategies.
Plan, conduct and prepare a scientific report on a complex survey of a workplace atmospheric contaminant in a manner useful for health risk assessment purposes.
Apply occupational hygiene principles to the completion of hazardous chemical risk assessments.

assessments.task_description:
Students will be presented with a number of typical occupational hygiene issues and asked to prepare a response based on the scenario provided. The problem will require students to further develop and apply their knowledge and understanding of hazardous chemical monitoring and control. The assignment has a maximum word length of 2500 words.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets required.

The report is to be prepared in the style of a hygiene consultant's report with the aim of providing useful information for the purpose of completing a health risk assessment. The assignment has a maximum word length of 3000.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 1: Introduction to occupational hygiene and revision of toxicological principles #2

This course will be delivered over two, three-day face-to-face blocks. The blocks will consist of lectures, workshops, and practicals.

During the lectures and workshops for this module, students will gain an understanding of the principles and practice of occupational hygiene and will revise key toxicological principles required for the practice of occupational hygiene.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02

learning_activities.topic:
Module 2: Occupational hygiene process

This course will be delivered over two, three-day face-to-face blocks. The blocks will consist of lectures, workshops, and practicals.

During the lectures and workshops for this module, students will gain an understanding of the occupational hygiene process and the various strategies employed in the conduct of hygiene monitoring, including personal, workplace, and biological sample collection.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02

learning_activities.topic:
Module 3: Workplace Exposure Limits (WELs)

This course will be delivered over two, three-day face-to-face blocks. The blocks will consist of lectures, workshops, and practicals.

During the lectures and workshops for this module, students will gain an understanding of the development, review and update of workplace exposure limits (WELs) and importantly the practical application of WELs in occupational hygiene.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L06

learning_activities.topic:
Module 4: Statistics

This course will be delivered over two, three-day face-to-face blocks. The blocks will consist of lectures, workshops, and practicals.

During the lectures and workshops for this module, students will gain an understanding of the statistical techniques used to analyse, interpret, and present the results from occupational hygiene monitoring.

Learning outcomes: L01, L05

learning_activities.topic:
Module 8: Report writing, communication and ethics

This course will be delivered over two, three-day face-to-face blocks. The blocks will consist of lectures, workshops, and practicals.

During the lectures and workshops for this module, students will gain an understanding of, and ability to apply, the principles of occupational hygiene to the communication of occupational hygiene with various stakeholders, including workers, management, and government. Students will also develop an ability to write occupational hygiene reports in line with the requirements of the AIOH Report Writing Guideline and to consider the ethical implications of the role of an occupational hygienist.

Learning outcomes: L01, L05, L06
